function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of effective local response strategies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Continuing increases in the human population, crowding, and human movement","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Environmental changes and ecosystem complexity related to human activities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective public health response and infrastructure","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Authoritarian dimension of public health emergencies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of rapid adaptation to new circumstances","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on tracking applications for monitoring population dynamics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Collective behavior changes due to past epidemic experience","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shift from patient-centered to community-centered care in healthcare systems","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of functioning restrooms in parks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Violation of curfews and pandemic restrictions","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Managers not networking and sharing information about adaptive responses to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of leadership and interest in investing in green areas","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited participation of neighbors and stakeholders in governance of green areas in latin america","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Weak governance of urban green spaces","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of collaboration and networks among mid-size city public service managers","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Maladaptation in the usage of urban green spaces","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Bringing activities to open green spaces without proper planning may lead to increased risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to incorporate green areas into urban policy may lead to inadequate planning for disease mitigation and public health in urban environments.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of investment in green areas could result in inadequate maintenance and deterioration, leading to decreased public health benefits and potential disease transmission risks.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resistance to change in decision-making may limit the implementation of measures to enhance green area relevance and public health benefits.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of piloting mobility pattern changes","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of networking among park managers","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Underutilization of smart city resources","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate governance of urban green spaces in latin american cities","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate protocol, staff, and equipment for managing limited access and monitoring compliance in green spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differential access to green areas leading to avoidance of parks in poorer neighborhoods during the pandemic.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of citizen participation in governance of urban green spaces during the pandemic.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of expert-citizens on policy design without comprehensive stakeholder engagement.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on non-capital cities and small cities in policy and research agendas","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of interdisciplinary personnel and networks in public services governance","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of training in ecosystems and environmental issues for top management in public services","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of training and network-related capital in inter-agency governance","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Leadership-dependent effectiveness in dedicated management governance","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of citizen participation in pandemic response","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of controlled access to parks contributing to increased virus spread due to crowd movement and unsupervised access to open parks.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of preparedness for adjusting public services during a time of crisis, leading to inadequate implementation of adaptive measures.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of network and knowledge sharing among public service managers, hampering the ability to adapt services to changing demands during a crisis.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inter-agency governance compensating for lack of training and network-related capital, leading to improved coordination and response to crisis situations.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for transmission of contagious diseases in urban green spaces during a time of social crisis.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Governance challenges in managing urban green spaces during the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close proximity within the white circles could lead to increased spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access and multiple entry points may lead to inconsistent enforcement of mask-wearing and temperature checks, increasing the risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Encouraging physical interaction through the use of mirrors and banners could lead to unintended close contact and potential spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Closure of parks with physical barriers and instruction not to visit other parks may lead to overcrowding in the open parks.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pilot opening of parks without monitoring precautions may lead to non-compliance with safety measures.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conversion of roads to pedestrian areas may lead to increased interaction and close contact among pedestrians.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of personnel to monitor protocol compliance","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient communication and awareness","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Non-compliance with protocol by park visitors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"}]}
